FuncDef:
The accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command configures a device to add all IP addresses assigned to an IPoE user to the user's accounting stop packets sent to a RADIUS server.
The undo accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command restores the default configuration.
By default, an IPoE user's accounting stop packet sent to a RADIUS server carries only the IP address of the stack where the user is currently online.
CLIs: undo accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a dual-stack IPoE access scenario, a RADIUS server may use the IP addresses carried in accounting stop packets to manage users' accounting information. By default, the accounting stop packet of a dual-stack IPoE user carries only the IP address of the stack where the user is currently online , without the IP address of the stack where the user has gone offline and has been released. To meet the IP address-based accounting management requirement of a RADIUS server, run the accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command to configure a device to add all IP addresses assigned to an IPoE user to the user's accounting stop packets sent to a RADIUS server.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command is mutually exclusive with the ipoe-server multi-sessions per-mac enable command.If an IPv6 address pool has been bound to the domain and the dhcpv6-unshare-only command has been run in the prefix pool corresponding to the IPv6 address pool, running the accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command is not allowed.If an IPv6 address pool of the RUI-slave type has been bound to the domain, this IPv6 address pool has been bound to the RBS, and the dhcpv6-server destination rbs command has been run for the RBS, running the accounting-stop-packet include all-stack-ip user-type ipoe command is not allowed.In case of pre-authentication domain and post-authentication domain switching, you need to run this command in both the pre-authentication domain and post-authentication domain to make the function take effect.
